image.altText: shark surfer

props.synopsis: While the South Australian government has rejected a shark cull in the wake of a third fatal attack in seven months, there are calls from some within the surfing community for other possible responses.

title.children: Search on for prevention measures after three fatal shark attacks in South Australia this year

image.altText: A man speaks.

props.synopsis: Farmers, regional residents and South Australia's motoring lobby want a backlog of road maintenance completed, amid the deadliest year on SA's roads since 2019.

title.children: Regional drivers, motoring lobby calls for urgent fix of SA's roads as death toll soars

image.altText: Large rubbish bins filled to the brim.

props.synopsis: The festive season is one of gift giving, and one many Australians use to pass on their pre-loved items to a new home. Here's a rough guide on the best way to donate this holiday period.

title.children: 'OK for a mate, OK to donate': The dos and don'ts of post-Christmas charity giving

image.altText: A man sits in front of a large trophy

props.synopsis: As cash use for everyday transactions declines, regulators ponder how soon Australia may go cashless or whether Australians may have to bear the costs of using cash.

title.children: 'Carrying cash is Plan B: If the cards aren't working, you don't get the goods'

image.altText: A lady is holding a drink in a dimly lit bar.

props.synopsis: Emily was 18 years old and out with friends at a Canberra nightclub when someone spiked her drink, and she was later sexually assaulted. Her story isn't unique, with spiking being chronically under-reported and hard to substantiate.

title.children: Emily's drink was spiked in a nightclub. Advocates say the crime is under-reported and hard to substantiate

image.altText: A plastic wrapped contained with extensive barnacle growth on the sand

props.synopsis: A total of 124 kilograms of cocaine has been found in sealed packages scattered along the coastline by members of the public over the past week.

title.children: Police warn people searching beaches for cocaine after two people rescued

image.altText: A smiling boy with zinc on his face at the beach.

props.synopsis: A 15-year-old boy killed by a shark at a popular tourism and surfing location on South Australia's Yorke Peninsula is being remembered as a "talented and dearly loved" young surfer.

title.children: Teen shark attack victim identified, as tributes flow for 'dearly loved' surfer

image.altText: A shopping mall damaged by air strikes.

props.synopsis: Ukrainian officials say Russia has launched 122 missiles and 36 drones in one night, hitting hospitals, apartment blocks and schools.

title.children: Russia launches 'most massive aerial attack' since invasion of Ukraine

image.altText: Israeli soldiers are seen at a staging area near the Israeli-Gaza border, walking near military vehicles.

props.synopsis: Israel's campaign, which has already flattened much of Gaza's north, is now focused on the territory's central refugee camps.

title.children: Israel reportedly hits aid convoy, and thousands cram into dense Gaza areas as strikes continue

image.altText: Labelling on a packet of Doritos corn chips.

props.synopsis: A union claims workers at a Smith's Chips factory in Adelaide have been experiencing breathing difficulties and skin irritation from a seasoning used on a spicy snack food.

title.children: Spicy Doritos seasoning leaving factory workers with 'skin irritation' and 'difficulty breathing', union claims

image.altText: A computer generated image of a white truck towing a green trailer that reads 'Fuel for life'

props.synopsis: With 2030 emissions reductions targets looming, a potential Adelaide-Melbourne hydrogen freight route could present a greener option.

title.children: This 'HyWay' could move freight interstate with zero emissions, but would companies use it?

image.altText: A lightning strike hits over the Sunshine Coast

props.synopsis: Queenslanders are being urged to remain vigilant across the weekend, with destructive wind gusts, giant hail, heavy rainfall and flash flooding predicted.

title.children: Car struck by lightning as more wild weather hits storm-ravaged Queensland

image.altText: Tina Holt in her home decorated by paintings she has created herself.

props.synopsis: For decades, housing development in suburban Australia has favoured large family homes with backyards, but experts say there's a growing need for one and two-bedroom dwellings.

title.children: Australians dream of owning a three-bedroom home, but is it what our housing market needs?

image.altText: A man wearing a black t-shirt standing in front of a brick wall.

props.synopsis: The cost of living, low rental vacancies and the housing crisis has forced more Australians into homelessness, putting immense strain on support services trying to help.

title.children: 'Worst year on record': How the cost of living crisis has changed the face of homelessness

image.altText: Composite image of food in plastic containers and thermal paper receipt

props.synopsis: Shopping dockets? You are probably better off not handling them. Microwaving food in plastic? That is also not advised — and it is because of the 'disrupting' chemicals, which experts say are affecting vital systems in the human body.

title.children: 'Don't ever reheat it in the plastic container': Tips to avoid endocrine-disrupting chemicals that are all around us

image.altText: Mohammad Rizwan of Pakistan speaks to umpire Joel Wilson during a DRS review at the Boxing Day Test.

props.synopsis: Pakistan coach Mohammad Hafeez says his side outplayed Australia at the MCG, claiming poor umpiring and the use of technology denied the tourists victory.

title.children: Pakistan blames 'inconsistent umpiring' for Boxing Day Test defeat

image.altText: Muhammad Rizwan talks to the umpire

props.synopsis: Pakistan makes a tremendous fist of a tough run chase thanks to a couple of costly drops, but a debatable dismissal helped hand the Aussies a hard-fought victory. Here's the five quick hits from day four of the Boxing Day Test.

title.children: Five quick hits — Two debatable dismissals and costly drops as Australia battles to victory

image.altText: girl with orange glasses and overalls smiling

props.synopsis: When Ayla was diagnosed with Leukaemia earlier this year, one of her biggest worries was falling behind at school.

title.children: 'Normalness amongst the chaos': Queensland's first virtual hospital school helps sick kids keep learning

image.altText: Teddies being restored after the Cairns 2023 floods.

props.synopsis: Many sentimental items are lost when floods devastate towns. But in Cairns, much-loved childhood keepsakes are being rescued and restored by a group of caring volunteers.

title.children: How a teddy day spa is saving flood-damaged childhood treasures from ending up in the tip

image.altText: A group of people gesturing at a giant swinging orange tie

props.synopsis: Billionaire Hermès heir Nicolas Puech is reportedly planning to bequeath part of his fortune to his gardener. It comes more than a decade after he walked away from the fashion company following a rival label's failed takeover bid.

title.children: He walked away from the family firm with $17b. Now this Hermès descendant has a plan for his riches

image.altText: A woman in a pink floral top and black pants standing in front of a pink mural depicting multiple birds

props.synopsis: Determined to maintain traditions, here's how these Australians redefined what the holidays are all about to make it meaningful on a budget.

title.children: How these Australians made the holidays special despite prohibitive travel prices

image.altText: A woman with brown hair stares soulfully at the camera.

props.synopsis: New age spiritualism is not new, but it morphed during the COVID pandemic and appears more popular than ever. The first detailed Australian study examines what happens when spirituality and wellness intersect with conspiracy theories.

title.children: Raquel lives 'off the grid' and is part of a growing trend of people finding meaning in new age spiritual practices

image.altText: Birds eye view of several emergency services with lights on at the scene of a major crash

props.synopsis: Two people are dead and many more are injured following a multi-vehicle crash on the Great Western Highway near Lithgow.

title.children: Five-vehicle collision kills two, injures 15 people, on NSW's Great Western Highway

image.altText: A man holds up a trophy and grins whilst onlookers clap.

props.synopsis: The Sydney to Hobart yacht race has been run and won by a self-confessed frustrated sailor who thinks his boat does better when he's asleep below deck. So who is Christian Beck?

title.children: This tech millionaire was first to finish the Sydney to Hobart but he's happy to give the credit to his crew

image.altText: A young man with dark hair, a beard, a suit and glasses walks on the street.

props.synopsis: The action comes after nine videos of the defamation hearing, which was live streamed, appeared on the channel.

title.children: Judge orders publisher of 'Feminism Debunked' YouTube channel to appear in court over Lehrmann hearing videos

image.altText: A cat and a dog lying next to each other in the grass

props.synopsis: Our furry friends are just as susceptible as us humans to heat-related ailments. So here are some tips to keep your pets, no matter big or small, cool during the sweltering heat.

title.children: How does extreme heat affect my pet? Here's how to keep them cool this summer

image.altText: Three adults, a child and a dog in a small children's pool.

props.synopsis: Much of northern Australia is battling through a heatwave with conditions set to peak over the weekend and remain into the New Year. As scorching temperatures hit storm-ravaged communities, residents get creative to keep cool.

title.children: Tips to keep cool as new year heatwave settles in and BOM issues severe storm warnings for Qld, NSW

image.altText: Alex de Minaur stretches for a forehand return in the United Cup.

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur and Ajla Tomljanović go down in their respective singles rubbers, as the host nation falls to Great Britain 2-1 at the mixed-teams event in Perth.

title.children: Aussies begin United Cup campaign with loss to Great Britain

image.altText: Donald Day and his wife Sabrina

props.synopsis: An American extremist linked to the Wieambilla killers claims he wished he had joined in on their massacre of Queensland police officers, a US court hears.

title.children: Inside the violent history of the US sovereign citizen linked to the Wieambilla police killings

image.altText: A hand holds a calculator that reads 0 over some papers

props.synopsis: As the cost-of-living crisis plunges more households into financial uncertainty and at least one-third of Australians struggle to make ends meet, it's more important than ever to ask yourself: how financially resilient am I?

title.children: Could you cope with a shock to your bank balance? Five ways to check if you're financially resilient

image.altText: China former Navy chief Dong Jun.

props.synopsis: The appointment by Chinese lawmakers comes as President Xi Jinping upgrades the military as part of his push to make China a dominant world power, a goal that has alarmed many of its neighbours.

title.children: With his predecessors still missing from public view, former navy chief Dong Jun is named China's defence minister

image.altText: A family of four smile at the camera.

props.synopsis: The Rockhampton community rallies around Bronwyn Nunn and her children, after her husband Tony died from cancer and just hours later a fire destroyed their home.

title.children: Within hours on Boxing Day, this family lost their husband and father, and then their home

image.altText: A child has their teeth examined by a dentist.

props.synopsis: A US woman says a dentist performed four root canals, eight dental crowns and 20 fillings on her in a single appointment, leaving her disfigured.

title.children: Woman sues dentist for allegedly carrying out dozens of procedures in single visit

image.altText: A young man in a striped blazer and white shirt

props.synopsis: Bushfires that destroyed nearly 12,000 hectares on Western Australia's south coast and cost the life of young firefighter Harry Stead have been brought under control.

title.children: Bushfires that cost the life of young volunteer firefighter under control as tributes flow

image.altText: Anastasia Ivleeva posted for a picture with GeeGun during an almost naked party. She's in a lacey black bra. He's shirtless.

props.synopsis: Russian authorities crack down on celebrities who attended a racy costume party in a Moscow nightclub, as the Kremlin continues to pursue an increasingly conservative regime.

title.children: 'Almost naked' party of Russian elites brings jail time, a lawsuit and apologies
